channel.title: Romania on Logotyp.us
channel.description: Recent content in Romania on Logotyp.us

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 CFR Cluj Logo
Fotbal Club CFR 1907 Cluj, commonly known as CFR Cluj, is a Romanian professional football club based in the city of Cluj-Napoca, Cluj County, which competes in the Liga I. It was founded in 1907 as Kolozsvári Vasutas Sport Club, when Transylvania was part of Austria-Hungary, and the current name CFR is the acronym for Căile Ferate Române. Before its latest promotion to the Liga I in 2004, the club had spent most of its existence in the lower divisions.
You can download theCFRlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: CFR
item.description: Fotbal Club CFR 1907 Cluj, commonly known as CFR Cluj, is a Romanian professional football club based in the city of Cluj-Napoca, Cluj County, which competes in the Liga I. It was founded in 1907 as Kolozsvári Vasutas Sport Club, when Transylvania was part of Austria-Hungary, and the current name CFR is the acronym for Căile Ferate Române. Before its latest promotion to the Liga I in 2004, the club had spent most of its existence in the lower divisions.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 FC Dinamo București Logo
Fotbal Club Dinamo București, commonly known as Dinamo București or simply Dinamo, is a Romanian professional football club based in Bucharest. Founded in 1948, they have spent their entire history in Romania’s top tier, the Liga I. Domestically, Dinamo București is one of the two most successful teams in the country, having won 18 Liga I, 13 Cupa României, two Supercupa României, and one Cupa Ligii. In the 1983–84 season, they became the first Romanian club to reach the semi-finals of the European Cup.
You can download theDinamo Bucurestilogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Dinamo Bucuresti
item.description: Fotbal Club Dinamo București, commonly known as Dinamo București or simply Dinamo, is a Romanian professional football club based in Bucharest. Founded in 1948, they have spent their entire history in Romania’s top tier, the Liga I. Domestically, Dinamo București is one of the two most successful teams in the country, having won 18 Liga I, 13 Cupa României, two Supercupa României, and one Cupa Ligii. In the 1983–84 season, they became the first Romanian club to reach the semi-finals of the European Cup.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
FCSB Logo
Fotbal Club FCSB is a Romanian professional football club based in Bucharest. It has spent its entire history in the Romanian highest tier, the Liga I. The original FC Steaua București team was part of the namesake CSA Steaua București sports club and belonged to the Ministry of National Defence. In 1998, the club and facilities were separated from the sports club and taken over by a group of shareholders in a post-Ceaușescu privatisation scheme, allegedly leading to one of the shareholders acquiring full ownership five years later.
You can download theFCSBlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: FCSB
item.description: Fotbal Club FCSB is a Romanian professional football club based in Bucharest. It has spent its entire history in the Romanian highest tier, the Liga I. The original FC Steaua București team was part of the namesake CSA Steaua București sports club and belonged to the Ministry of National Defence. In 1998, the club and facilities were separated from the sports club and taken over by a group of shareholders in a post-Ceaușescu privatisation scheme, allegedly leading to one of the shareholders acquiring full ownership five years later.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 FC Rapid București Logo
Fotbal Club Rapid 1923, commonly known as Rapid București or simply as Rapid, is a Romanian professional football club based in Bucharest, which competes in the Liga I. It was founded in 1923 by employees of the Grivița workshops as Asociația Culturală și Sportivă CFR. Domestically, Rapid București is one of the most successful clubs in the country, having won three national titles, 13 Cupa României and four Supercupa României.
You can download theRapid Bucurestilogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Rapid Bucuresti
item.description: Fotbal Club Rapid 1923, commonly known as Rapid București or simply as Rapid, is a Romanian professional football club based in Bucharest, which competes in the Liga I. It was founded in 1923 by employees of the Grivița workshops as Asociația Culturală și Sportivă CFR. Domestically, Rapid București is one of the most successful clubs in the country, having won three national titles, 13 Cupa României and four Supercupa României.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 CS Universitatea Craiova Logo
U Craiova 1948 Club Sportiv, commonly known as Universitatea Craiova, U Craiova, or CS U Craiova, is a Romanian professional football team based in Craiova, Dolj County, currently playing in the Liga I, the top tier of the Romanian football league system. It was initially founded in 1948 as a football section for the CSU Craiova sports club of which it was part of until 1991, when its berth in the league championship was taken by FC U Craiova following a privatisation scheme.
You can download theUniversitatea Craiovalogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Universitatea Craiova
item.description: U Craiova 1948 Club Sportiv, commonly known as Universitatea Craiova, U Craiova, or CS U Craiova, is a Romanian professional football team based in Craiova, Dolj County, currently playing in the Liga I, the top tier of the Romanian football league system. It was initially founded in 1948 as a football section for the CSU Craiova sports club of which it was part of until 1991, when its berth in the league championship was taken by FC U Craiova following a privatisation scheme.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 FC UTA Arad Logo
Asociația Fotbal Club UTA Arad, commonly known as UTA Arad, or simply as UTA, is a Romanian professional football club based in the city of Arad, Arad County, currently playing in Liga I. UTA stands for Uzina Textilă Arad. Founded in 1945 as IT Arad, they have won the national title six times and the national cup twice. Domestically, along with Chinezul Timișoara, UTA can be considered one of the most successful Romanian clubs of the 20th century, with only three teams winning more championships during that period—Steaua, Dinamo and Venus, all from Bucharest.
You can download theUTA Aradlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: UTA Arad
item.description: Asociația Fotbal Club UTA Arad, commonly known as UTA Arad, or simply as UTA, is a Romanian professional football club based in the city of Arad, Arad County, currently playing in Liga I. UTA stands for Uzina Textilă Arad. Founded in 1945 as IT Arad, they have won the national title six times and the national cup twice. Domestically, along with Chinezul Timișoara, UTA can be considered one of the most successful Romanian clubs of the 20th century, with only three teams winning more championships during that period—Steaua, Dinamo and Venus, all from Bucharest.

<! [CDATA[
Popp & Asociații Logo Popp & Asociații is a professional services company based in Bucharest, Romania. It provides structural design & assessment, consultancy, retrofitting design, and project management services for all aspects of the built environment either existing or new, including infrastructure works design. Source
You can download thePopp Asociatiilogo on full-version of the page. ]] >

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
UPC Romania Logo UPC Romania was a telecommunications company in Romania, which provided cable television, broadband internet and fixed telephony to approximately 1 million customers. On July 31, 2019, Vodafone acquired the company and it was merged into Vodafone Romania on 31 March 2020. Source
You can download theUPClogo on full-version of the page. ]] >

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Softpedia Logo Softpedia is a software and tech-news website based in Romania. It indexes, reviews and hosts downloadable software, has dedicated sections for Windows, Mac, Linux, Games, Drivers, Mobile, Webscripts, and News, and reports on technology and science topics from both external and in-house sources. Source
You can download theSoftpedialogo on full-version of the page. ]] >

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Grup Servicii Petroliere Logo
Grup Servicii Petroliere is a Romanian company providing offshore integrated services for oil and gas industry. The company, established in 2004, is a member of UPETROM Group. Grup Servicii Petroliere performs offshore integrated services for the oil and gas industry. GSP is a member of Upetrom Group, a private company. GSP operates seven offshore drilling rigs: GSP Saturn, GSP Jupiter, GSP Orizont, GSP Atlas, GSP Prometeu, GSP Fortuna and GSP Britannia.
You can download theGSPlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: GSP
item.description: Grup Servicii Petroliere is a Romanian company providing offshore integrated services for oil and gas industry. The company, established in 2004, is a member of UPETROM Group. Grup Servicii Petroliere performs offshore integrated services for the oil and gas industry. GSP is a member of Upetrom Group, a private company. GSP operates seven offshore drilling rigs: GSP Saturn, GSP Jupiter, GSP Orizont, GSP Atlas, GSP Prometeu, GSP Fortuna and GSP Britannia.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
OMV Petrom Logo OMV Petrom S.A. is a Romanian integrated oil company, controlled by Austria’s OMV. It is one of the largest corporations in Romania and the largest oil and gas producer in Southeast Europe. Since 2004 it is a subsidiary of OMV. Source
You can download thePetromlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Petrom
item.description: OMV Petrom S.A. is a Romanian integrated oil company, controlled by Austria’s OMV. It is one of the largest corporations in Romania and the largest oil and gas producer in Southeast Europe. Since 2004 it is a subsidiary of OMV. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Dacia Logo
Automobile Dacia S.A., commonly known as Dacia, is a Romanian car manufacturer that takes its name from the historic region that constitutes the present-day Romania. The company was established in 1966. In 1999, after 33 years, the Romanian government sold Dacia to the French car manufacturer Groupe Renault. It is Romania’s largest company by revenue and the largest exporter, constituting 8% of the country’s total exports in 2018. In 2019, the company sold 736,654 passenger and commercial vehicles.
You can download theDacialogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Dacia
item.description: Automobile Dacia S.A., commonly known as Dacia, is a Romanian car manufacturer that takes its name from the historic region that constitutes the present-day Romania. The company was established in 1966. In 1999, after 33 years, the Romanian government sold Dacia to the French car manufacturer Groupe Renault. It is Romania’s largest company by revenue and the largest exporter, constituting 8% of the country’s total exports in 2018. In 2019, the company sold 736,654 passenger and commercial vehicles.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Blue Air Logo Blue Air is a Romanian low-cost airline headquartered in Bucharest, with its hub at Henri Coandă International Airport. It is the largest Romanian airline by scheduled passengers flown. In 2017, Blue Air carried over 5 million passengers, a 40% increase over the 3.6 million passengers flown the previous year. As of February 2019, Blue Air flies to 57 scheduled destinations. Source
You can download theBlue Airlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Blue Air
item.description: Blue Air is a Romanian low-cost airline headquartered in Bucharest, with its hub at Henri Coandă International Airport. It is the largest Romanian airline by scheduled passengers flown. In 2017, Blue Air carried over 5 million passengers, a 40% increase over the 3.6 million passengers flown the previous year. As of February 2019, Blue Air flies to 57 scheduled destinations. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
TAROM Logo
TAROM, is the flag carrier and oldest currently operating airline of Romania, based in Otopeni near Bucharest. Its headquarters and its main hub are at Henri Coandă International Airport. It is currently the first and largest airline operating in Romania based on international destinations, international flights and the third-largest measured by fleet size and passengers carried. The brand name is an acronym for Romanian: Transporturile Aeriene Române. Over ninety-seven percent of TAROM is owned by the Romanian Government.
You can download theTAROMlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: TAROM

Its headquarters and its main hub are at Henri Coandă International Airport. It is currently the first and largest airline operating in Romania based on international destinations, international flights and the third-largest measured by fleet size and passengers carried. The brand name is an acronym for Romanian: Transporturile Aeriene Române. Over ninety-seven percent of TAROM is owned by the Romanian Government.
